urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 5:30am to 11am route 304 and 343 services will run to and from Martin Place instead of Circular Quay due to road closures. Buses will not run between Martin Place and Circular Quay, change for trains to continue your trip.
 
Buses to the city will end trips at Martin Place, Elizabeth St Stand C. Buses leaving the city towards the east will start trips from Martin Place, Elizabeth St, Stand E (Stop ID: 2000283).
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
subtitle: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Sydney CBD and North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses between the city and north shore will be starting and ending their trips in North Sydney while the Sydney Harbour Bridge is closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
  • From 4am to 10am services will start and end trips in North Sydney. Buses to the city will end trips at Miller St at Pacific Hwy, Victoria Cross (Stop ID 206052). Buses will start trips from Blue St North Sydney, Stand F (Stop ID 206015). Catch a train to continue your trip between North Sydney and the city.
  • From 10am to 3pm services will end trips Wynyard Station, York St, Stand P (Stop ID: 200048). Buses will start trips from Wynyard Station, York St, Stand K (Stop ID: 200033). Stops on Bridge St will be missed. 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
 
Missed stops 4am-10am
  • Pacific Highway at Walker Street, North Sydney (Stop ID: 206067)
  • North Sydney Station, Blue Street, Stand A, North Sydney (Stop ID: 206011)
  • Victoria Cross, Miller Street, North Sydney (Stop ID: 206013)
Missed stops 4am-3pm
  • Exchange Square, Bridge Street, Sydney (Stop ID: 2000148)
subtitle: Sydney CBD and North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

content:

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 2.30pm route 389 services will be split into two routes between Pyrmont and Town Hall, and between Woolloomooloo and Bondi Junction.
  • Buses from Pyrmont will leave from Harris St at Pyrmont Bridge Rd (Stop ID: 200916) and end trips at Town Hall Station, Park St, Stand H (Stop ID: 2000249). Buses from Town Hall to Pyrmont will pick up from Park St and end trips at Miller St before Harris St, (Stop ID: 200932). Stops on Pirrama Rd will be missed.
  • Buses to Bondi Junction will start trips from Crown St at Robinson St (Stop ID: 2010100). Buses from Bondi Junction towards the city will end trips at Crown St at Suttor St (Stop ID: 201028).
Continue on foot between Woolloomooloo and Town Hall for connecting buses between Pyrmont and Bondi, alternatively consider catching trains instead.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
subtitle: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Sydney CBD and North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses between the city and north shore will be starting and ending their trips in North Sydney while the Sydney Harbour Bridge is closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
  • From 4am to 10am services will start and end trips in North Sydney. Buses to the city will end trips at Miller St at Pacific Hwy, Victoria Cross (Stop ID: 206052). Buses will start trips from Blue St North Sydney, Stand C (Stop ID: 203092). Catch a train to continue your trip between North Sydney and the city.
  • From 10am to 3pm services will end trips Wynyard Station, York St, Stand P (Stop ID: 200048). Buses will start trips from Wynyard Station, York St, Stand K (Stop ID: 200033). Stops on Bridge St will be missed.
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
 
Missed stops: 4am-10am
  • Pacific Highway at Walker Street, North Sydney (Stop ID: 206067)
Missed stops 4am-3pm
  • Bridge Street at Gresham Street, Sydney (Stop ID: 200096)
  • Burns Philp Building, Bridge Street, Sydney (Stop ID: 2000417)
subtitle: Sydney CBD and North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Circular Quay Wharf Changes to Evening Operations
content:
From 8pm each evening Monday to Sunday, commencing on Monday 26 June, the following changes will apply:
  • F1 Manly services will be relocated from Circular Quay Wharf 3 to Wharf 4, starting with the 8.20pm service onwards
  • F3 Parramatta, F4 Pyrmont Bay and F8 Cockatoo Island services to operate from Wharf 5
  • F5 Neutral Bay, F6 Mosman Bay, F7 Darling Point (Double Bay wharf is currently closed for 6 months) and F9 Watsons Bay services to operate from Wharf 4

urlText: T1 Western Line: Buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown
content:
Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 September   
  • Buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Blacktown and Central, platforms 1-12 only.
  • Richmond trains run between Richmond and Olympic Park. Change at Parramatta to continue your journey towards the City.
  • Sunday from 6.30am to 10.30am, Richmond trains run between Richmond and Leppington.

  • Doonside Station: The footbridge will be closed. A shuttle bus service will run between the Hill End Road side of the station to Doonside Road. Please allow extra time.   

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes

71T1 Penrith, then express to Blacktown and return

urlText: Cabramatta bus diversions for Moon Festival
content:
From 12.01am to 11.59pm Sunday 17 September, buses will be diverting around a section of Railway Parade and missing stops due to road closures for the Cabramatta Moon Festival event.
 
Services will start and end their trips at the relocated bus interchange on Railway Parade, between McBurney Road and Hughes Street.
 
Services travelling to Cabramatta will be diverting via Cabramatta Road West, Hill Street, McBurney Road, Railway Parade. Services travelling from Cabramatta will divert via Hughes Street, Hill Street and Cabramatta Road West.
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time. Visit the Cabramatta Moon Festival event page for more details.
 
Missed and alternative stops
  • The Uniting Church, Hughes Street (216684)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Hill Street at Hughes Street (2166107) OR Railway Parade at McBurney Road (2166263)
  • Hughes Street before Railway Parade (2166108)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at Hughes Street (2166262)
  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Parade, Stand E (216671)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at Hughes Street (2166262)
  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Parade, Stand D (216672)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at Hughes St (2166262)

urlText: Station Update - Revesby
content: From Monday 14 August 2023, sections of the Revesby Station car park off Marco Avenue will be closed for up to 10 weeks. The existing accessible parking spaces will be relocated within the existing car park.This is to enable power supply upgrade work as part of the AC Feeder project. Alternative parking for rail passengers is available at the multi-storey Revesby Commuter Car Park located adjacent to Haydock Lane.

urlText: Robert St, Rozelle, temporary bus stop closures
content:
On the following nights:
  • 9pm to 5am Monday 28 August 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Wednesday 30 August 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Thursday 31 August 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Monday 4 September 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Wednesday 6 September 2023
  • 9pm to 5am Thursday 7 September 2023
Due to Rozelle Interchange work, the following bus stop will be temporarily closed:

    • 442 – Balmain

    • 441 – Birchgrove 
    • 442 – Balmain
There will be alternative stops for some services as a result of the following temporary bus stop closures: 
  • Bus stop Mullens St at Reynolds St (204146) will be temporarily closed.
  • Bus stop Mullens St at Beattie St (204147) will be temporarily closed.
  • Bus stop Montague St before Darling St (204148) will be temporarily closed.
    • The alternative stop for the 441 to Birchgrove service will be Rowntree St after Darling St (204114).

urlText: Buses replace trains between Glenfield and Liverpool
content:
Saturday 9 and Sunday 10 September
  • Buses replace trains between Glenfield and Liverpool.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Leppington and the City via the Airport, and between Liverpool and Olympic Park or Schofields.
  • Some early morning and late-night trains run between Richmond and Olympic Park. You may need to change trains at Granville to continue your journey.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus route
16T2 Glenfield, Casula, Liverpool and return

urlText: Sydney CBD & North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will start and end their trips in North Sydney instead while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
  • From 4am to 10am, route 263 services to the city will operate between Crows Nest and North Sydney via Cremorne only. Buses will end trips at North Sydney Station, Blue St, Stand F (Stop ID: 206015). Buses towards Crows Nest will also start trips from North Sydney Station Blue St Stand F. Stops at Wynyard will be missed in both directions. Passengers will need to catch a train to continue their trip between North Sydney and the city.
  • From 10am to 3pm, route 263 buses will operate between Crows Nest and Wynyard Station via Cremorne. Buses to the city will end trips at Wynyard Station, York St Stand P. Buses towards Crows Nest will start from Wynyard York St, Stand L. Stops on Bridge St will be missed.
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
 
Missed stops:
  • Bridge St at Gresham St (Stop ID: 200096)
  • Burns Philip Building, Bridge St (Stop ID: 2000417)
subtitle: Sydney CBD & North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Cabramatta bus diversions for Moon Festival
content:
From 12.01am to 11.59pm Sunday 17 September, buses will be diverting around a section of Railway Parade and missing stops due to road closures for the Cabramatta Moon Festival event.
 
Services will start and end their trips at the relocated bus interchange on Railway Parade, between McBurney Road and Hughes Street.
 
Services travelling to Cabramatta will be diverting via McBurney Road, Park Road, Hughes Street and Railway Parade. Services travelling from Cabramatta will not be impacted.
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time. Visit the Cabramatta Moon Festival event page for more details.
 
Missed and alternative stops
  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Parade, Stand E (216671)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at McBurney Road (2166263)
  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Parade, Stand A (2166249)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at McBurney Road (2166263)
subtitle: Cabramatta bus diversions for Moon Festival

urlText: Temporary bus service changes in Sydney's South and South West

For more information see the news story.
 
Please plan your trip or use trip planning apps each day before making your journey to get the latest information.

urlText: Buses replace trains between Bathurst and Blacktown
content:
Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 September
  • Buses replace trains between Bathurst and Blacktown.
  • T1 Western Line trains run between Blacktown and the City, to a changed timetable.

  • If you are travelling to Lithgow to connect with NSW TrainLink Regional Coaches, please call 132 232 to confirm departure times.
  • Warrimoo Station: The footbridge will be closed. A shuttle bus service will run between the Great Western Highway to Railway Parade. Please allow extra time.   

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
1ABM Springwood, then all stations to Penrith and return
2BM Bathurst, then express to Lithgow and return
4BM Katoomba, then all stations to Blaxland, then express to Blacktown and return
10BM Bathurst, then Tarana, Rydal, Lithgow and return
17BM Bathurst, Lithgow, Mt Victoria, Katoomba, Springwood, Penrith then Blacktown and return
53BM Lithgow, then all stations to Katoomba, Springwood, Blaxland, Blacktown and return
56BM Mount Victoria, then all stations to Katoomba, Springwood, Blaxland, Blacktown and return
96BM Warrimoo Station Shuttle (Great Western Highway to Railway Parade) return
subtitle: Buses replace trains between Bathurst and Blacktown

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 5am to 2:30pm route 333 services will operate between Bondi Beach and Kings Cross only. Buses will not continue to Circular Quay.
 
Buses towards the city from Bondi will end trips at Bayswater Rd near Kellett St (Temporary Stop ID: 201162). Buses towards Bondi will start trips from Kings Cross Station, Bayswater Rd, Stand D (Stop ID: 201115).
 
Change at Bondi Junction station for trains towards Martin Place/Circular Quay instead.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
subtitle: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Sydney CBD and North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will start and end their trips in North Sydney instead while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
  • From 4am to 10am, route 263 services to the city will operate between Crows Nest and North Sydney via Cremorne only. Buses will end trips at North Sydney Station, Blue St, Stand F (Stop ID: 206015). Buses towards Crows Nest will also start trips from North Sydney Station Blue St Stand F. Stops at Wynyard will be missed in both directions. Passengers will need to catch a train to continue their trip between North Sydney and the city.
  • From 10am to 3pm, route 263 buses will operate between Crows Nest and Wynyard Station via Cremorne. Buses to the city will end trips at Wynyard Station, York St Stand P. Buses towards Crows Nest will start from Wynyard York St, Stand L. Stops on Bridge St will be missed.
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
 
Missed stops:
  • Bridge St at Gresham St (Stop ID: 200096)
  • Burns Philip Building, Bridge St (Stop ID: 2000417)
subtitle: Sydney CBD and North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 6am to 2:30pm route 311 services will operate a loop service between Woolloomooloo and Darlinghurst only.

Services will start trips from Kings Cross Station, Darlinghurst Rd, Stand A (Stop ID: 201111) then travel via Cathedral St, Crown St, Sir John Young Cres, Riley St, William St, Crown St, then as normal to Darlinghurst Rd, ending trips at Kings Cross Station, Darlinghurst Rd, Stand B (Stop ID 201112) near Bayswater Rd.

Sunday 17 September
  • From 3am to 9.50am, buses replace trains between Bomaderry, Kiama and Wollongong.
  • Trains run between Port Kembla, Wollongong and Hurstville or Bondi Junction, some to a changed timetable.
  • The 02:39 Kiama to Bondi Junction service will run up to 14 minutes earlier than the normal timetable from Kiama to Coniston, then run to the normal timetable from Wollongong to Bondi Junction.
  • The first train to Kiama leaves Bondi Junction at 07:13, Wollongong at 08:59 and arrives Kiama at 09:47.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
1SC Kiama, then all stations to Bomaderry and return
2SC Wollongong, then Kiama and return
3SC Wollongong, then all stations to Dapto and return
5SC Kiama, then Bombo, Minnamurra, Shellharbour Junction, Oak Flats and return (bypassing Bombo in the Oak Flats direction)
6SC Wollongong, then all stations to Kiama and return (bypassing Shellharbour Junction, Minnamurra and Bombo)
subtitle: Buses replace trains between Bomaderry, Kiama and Wollongong

urlText: Sydney CBD & North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses between the city and north shore will start and end their trips in North Sydney while the Sydney Harbour Bridge is closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 10am route 120 services will start and end trips in North Sydney. Buses to the city QVB will end trips at Miller St at Pacific Hwy, Victoria Cross (Stop ID 206052). Services that usually leave from the city will instead start trips from Blue St North Sydney, Stand F.
 
Passengers will need to catch a train to continue their trip between North Sydney and the city. Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops.
 
Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
 
Missed stops:
  • Lang Park, York Street, Sydney (Stop ID: 2000133)
  • Wynyard Station, York Street, Stand H, Sydney (Stop ID: 200029)
  • QVB, York Street, Stand E, Sydney (Stop ID: 2000136)
  • QVB, York Street, Stand D, Sydney (Stop ID: 200044)
  • Clarence Street at Council Place, Sydney (Stop ID: 2000139)
  • Wynyard Station, Clarence Street, Stand R, Sydney (Stop ID: 2000142)
subtitle: Sydney CBD & North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 5am to 2:30pm route 339 services towards the city will be diverting away from the bus roadway and using stops on Anzac Pde instead. Services leaving Central will divert around Anzac Pde via Crown St and Cleveland St. The bus stop on Flinders St will before South Dowling St Darlinghurst (Stop ID 201014) will be missed.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.

urlText: Cabramatta bus diversions for Moon Festival
content:
From 12.01am to 11.59pm Sunday 17 September, buses will be diverting around a section of Railway Parade and missing stops due to road closures for the Cabramatta Moon Festival event.
 
Services will start and end their trips at the relocated bus interchange on Railway Parade, between McBurney Road and Hughes Street.
 
Services travelling to Cabramatta will be diverting via John Street, Hill Street, McBurney Road and Railway Parade. Services travelling from Cabramatta will divert via Hughes Street and Hill Street.
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time. Visit the Cabramatta Moon Festival event page for more details.
 
Missed and alternative stops
  • The Uniting Church, Hughes Street (216684)
     Alternative stop is a temporary stop Hill Street at Hughes Street (2166107) OR Railway Parade at McBurney Road (2166263)
  • Hughes Street before Railway Parade (2166108)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at Hughes Street (2166262)
  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Parade, Stand E (216671)
     Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at Hughes Street (2166262)
  • Cabramatta Station, Railway Pde, Stand D (216672)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on Railway Parade at Hughes Street (2166262)
  • Hill St before John St (2166106)
    Alternative stop is a temporary stop on John St before Gladstone St (2166129)
subtitle: Cabramatta bus diversions for Moon Festival

urlText: Hunters Hill Wharf temporarily closed
content:
For safety reasons, Hunters Hill Wharf on Alexandra Street has been temporarily closed until further notice.
 
Privately operated Lane Cove and School service ferries will not use this wharf.
 
To assist passengers, the Lane Cove Ferry Service is temporarily adding an additional stop at Woolwich Wharf.
 
Please use the Trip Planner to find nearby alternatives.

content:
Saturday 9 and Sunday 10 September
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Hornsby and Wynyard only.
  • Trains will not run between Wynyard and Central, or on the City Circle. The light rail runs between Circular Quay, Wynyard and Central.

  • If you are travelling to:
    • Circular Quay, Town Hall or Central use the light rail
    • Museum or St James use local buses

  • T9 Northern Line trains run to a changed timetable between Berowra or Hornsby and Central, platforms 1-12, via Strathfield.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 2:30pm route 461X will end trips at St James Station, Elizabeth St Stand C, (Stop ID: 200057442) instead of the Domain. Buses will start trips from Museum Station, Elizabeth St Stand C (Stop ID: 200073). Stops on Park St, Riley St and William St will be missed.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.

urlText: MacArthur St, Parramatta temporary bus stop closures
content:
From 8pm Friday to 5am Monday on the following days:
  • Friday 18 to Monday 21 August
  • Friday 25 to Monday 28 August
  • Friday 15 to Monday 18 September
  • Friday 22 to Monday 25 September
  • Friday 29 September to Monday 2 October
Gasworks Bridge work will result in the following bus stop closures:
  • Bus stops MacArthur St before Thomas St (215044) and MacArthur St opp MacArthur Girls High School (2150117) will close. The alternative stop will be Victoria Rd at Wandsworth St (215068) for the 545 towards Parramatta.
  • Bus stops MacArthur Girls High School, MacArthur St (2150116) and MacArthur St after Thomas St (215043) will close. The alternative stop will be Victoria Rd at Brabyn St (215067) for the 545 towards Macquarie Park.
  • Bus stops George St after Smith St (215069) and George St before MacArthur St (215070) will close. The alternative stop will be Smith St before Phillip St (215066) for the 545 towards Macquarie Park.

urlText: Palm Beach ferry diversion due to navigational restrictions
content: Ferries are diverting to Patonga. A free shuttle bus is running between Ettalong and Patonga wharves from 5:30am until 9:30am and from 3:30pm until 6:30pm Monday to Friday, and at different times throughout the weekend. The shuttle bus leaves about 35 minutes before the ferry leaves Patonga Wharf. Please be aware that Patonga Wharf is not wheelchair accessible. Plan ahead. More information can be found here.

urlText: Sydney CBD & North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses between the Hills and the city will start and end their trips in North Sydney while the Sydney Harbour Bridge is closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.

From 4am to 10am route 607X, 610X and N92 services to the city will end trips at Pacific Hwy after Blue St in North Sydney. Services that usually leave from the city will instead start trips from Greenwood Plaza at Pacific Hwy (Stop ID: 206027).
 
Passengers will need to catch a train to continue their trip between North Sydney and the city. Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops.
 
Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.

From 4am to 10am, route 100 buses will operate a loop service between Taronga Zoo and North Sydney only. Services towards will end trips at North Sydney Station, Blue St, Stand D (Stop ID: 206014). Services towards Taronga Zoo will also start trips from North Sydney Station Blue St Stand D. Stops at Wynyard and QVB will be missed in both directions.
 
Passengers will need to catch a train to continue their trip between North Sydney and the city.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads in the city, Darlinghurst and Moore Park are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
Route 396 services will be affected in two stages throughout the day. In the morning services will divert around Oxford St closures, and start and end trips at Martin Place instead of Circular Quay. From 11am services will resume running to and from Circular Quay but continue diverting around Oxford St.
 
  • From 5:30am to 11am route 396 services towards the city will end trips at Martin Place, Elizabeth St Stand C and divert via Fitzroy St and Foveaux St to re-join Elizabeth St. Services leaving the city towards the east will start trips from Martin Place, Elizabeth St, Stand E (Stop ID: 2000283) and divert via Cleveland St and Anzac Pde.
  • From 11am to 2:30pm services will resume running to and from Circular Quay but continue to divert around Oxford St in both directions.
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
subtitle: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon

urlText: Special Events - Sunday 3 September
content:
NRLW: Roosters v Eels - Central Coast Stadium, Gosford
13:50 to 15:50
- The closest station to the stadium is Gosford on the Central Coast & Newcastle Line. It is a short walk via Showground Road and Dane Drive.

NRL: Sharks v Raiders - PointsBet Stadium (Shark Park), Woolooware
16:00 to 18:00
- Valid pre-purchased tickets include travel on Sydney Trains services.
- The closest station to the stadium is Woolooware on the T4 Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line. It is a short 15-minute walk from the station.
- Shuttle buses will pick up from Caringbah, Woolooware and Cronulla train stations from the time gates open.

For details, please visit https://transportnsw.info/events/2023/09

urlText: T1 North Shore Line: Trackwork may affect how you travel
content:
Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 September  
  • Trains run between Hornsby and Wynyard only, to a changed timetable.
  • From Wynyard, City Circle trains run in one direction, via Circular Quay. The light rail runs between Circular Quay, Wynyard, Town Hall and Central.
  • T9 Northern Line trains run to a changed timetable between Berowra or Hornsby and Central, platforms 1-12, via Strathfield.

  • From 7.30pm Saturday to 4.40am Sunday, buses replace trains between Berowra and Hornsby.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
3CN Hornsby, then all stations to Hawkesbury River and return
5CN Hornsby, Berowra, Tuggerah, Wyong and return
38CN Woy Woy, then Koolewong, Tascott, Point Clare, Berowra, Hornsby and return
61CN Hornsby, Berowra, Gosford, then all stations to Wyong and return

urlText: Victoria Rd, Rozelle, temporary bus stop closures
content:

  • 11pm to 5am on Thursday 24 August 2023
  • 11pm to 5am Thursday 31 August 2023
  • 11pm to 5am Thursday 7 September 2023
Due to Rozelle Interchange work, the following bus stop will be temporarily closed:

  • The following bus stops will temporarily close:
    • Victoria Rd opp Clubb St (203953)
    • Victoria Rd after Terry St (203911)
    • Victoria Rd at Wellington St (203912)
  • The alternative stop will be Temporary Bus Stop after Wellington St for the following services:
    • 500n –Hyde Park
    • 500x –Hyde Park

content:
Monday 4 to Friday 8 September  
  • Buses replace trains between Lithgow and Mount Victoria, then continue to Blackheath.

urlText: L2 and L3 lines morning partial closure and extra L1 early services during Sydney Marathon
content:
From first service at 5am to approximately 11am on Sunday 17 September, L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services will not run between Town Hall and Circular Quay, due to road closures for Sydney Marathon.
 
Catch light rail services to Town Hall and change for trains or walk to Circular Quay.
 
L2 and L3 light rail services will continue to run between Town Hall and Circular Quay as per normal schedule.
 
Extra L1 Dulwich Hill Line early morning services will run from 4am.
 
Visit the Sydney Marathon event page for more transport information.

urlText: Sydney CBD and North Shore bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses between the city and north shore will be starting and ending their trips in North Sydney while the Sydney Harbour Bridge is closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 10am route 252, 288, 290 and 292 services to the City Erskine St will end trips at Miller St at Pacific Hwy, Victoria Cross (Stop ID: 206052). Services that usually leave from the city will instead start trips from Blue St North Sydney, Stand B.
 
Passengers will need to catch a train to continue their trip between North Sydney and the city. Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be diverting while major roads including the Harbour Bridge are closed for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am to 2.30pm route 440 services will be split into two routes between Bondi Junction and Woolloomooloo, and between Rozelle and the city (St James/Museum Stations).
  • Buses from Rozelle will end trips at St James Station, Elizabeth St, Stand C (Stop ID: 200057). Buses towards Rozelle will start trips from Elizabeth St Museum Station, Downing Centre, Stand B (Stop ID: 200074).
  • Buses from Bondi Junction towards the city will end trips at Crown St at Suttor St (Stop ID: 201028). Buses towards Bondi Junction will start trips from Crown St at Robinson St (Stop ID: 2010100).
Continue on foot between Woolloomooloo and Town Hall for connecting buses between Rozelle and Bondi, alternatively consider catching trains to Bondi instead.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.

urlText: Sydney CBD bus diversions for Sydney Marathon
content:
On Sunday 17 September, buses to and from the city will be starting and ending their trips in North Sydney due to major road closures for the annual Sydney Marathon.
 
From 4am til last service route N90 services to the city will end trips Pacific Hwy at Walker St North Sydney (Stop ID 206067) instead of Town Hall. Services will start trips from North Sydney Station, Blue St, Stand D North Sydney (Stop ID 206014).
 
Passengers will need to catch a train to continue their trip between North Sydney and the city. Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops.
 
Route N91 services will be diverting via the Sydney Harbour Tunnel and will not make stops at Wynyard Station.
 
Please allow extra travel time and check signs at bus stops. Visit the Sydney Marathon 2023 event page for more transport details.
 
Missed stops
  • Wynyard Station, York St, Stand K (Stop ID: 200033)
  • Town Hall Station, Park St, Stand H (Stop ID: 2000249)
  • Town Hall Station, Park St, Stand K Sydney (Stop ID 2000252)
  • Wynyard Station, Clarence St, Stand R Sydney (Stop ID 2000142)
